history.text: Did you like Zootopia?
Yes, you?
I only watched it because of my children, but I did find it entertaining.
Same here, Grandson seems to like it a lot. It has a good message behind it. So i don't mind him watching it.
Any favorite characters? I would say mine was Nick, the fox, because he presented with important ideas of moral transformation.
I like Chief Bogo and Judy
Why would you choose them?
Bogo because he seems to stuggle with his issues of Judy being a rabbit and having to get over that
Judy because she seems to just never give up
Bogo seems to bash her and push her at the same time, if that makes sense.
What did you get most out of the story?

When watching the movie with your grandchildren, did you find the need to explain to them the characters or any of the scenes? My kids are older, so really didn't need much explaining. They however thought the naked scene was hilarious, because in their words, how can animals be naked and yet still seem as a racy scene?
My grandson is a bit younger 3, so he don't quite get all that yet, tho i did die laughing at that part. He does make comments about stuff like that. Why does one have on pants and another don't.
How do you feel about the movie pointing out Judy's use of Blackmail?

What did I get out of the story? Well, for me it showed me that no matter the situation in life; you never give up. That if you go for what you want in life, it is gonna take hard work and perseverance, and of course... never give up.
I agree, never giving up is the main thing i also got out of it.
Well, to blackmail period is wrong... but I feel as if Judy used to gain some advantage, considering her stature.
i agree, i also feel it was more in the end "teamwork" than blackmail
i think the movie shows just how judgmental people can actually be, when you show it as a cartoon its kinda spooky
I think cartoon form, tends to be easier to explain to children; it is more their level.
I think that this movie also touched a bit on racism.
I agree, if they messed with him for being a "fox" that kinda stands out to me
Zootopia was give a 98%  by Rotten Tomatoes, do you agree with that rating?
I think most cartoons get high marks, i don't think it ranks a 98%, do you?

But the racism reaches Judy as well, and maybe even some sexism. She is a small female non-predator race... All that is what is holding her back from her dreams. Which eventually she overcomes by showing her capabilities, but how many people are actually given the opportunity in life to do such a thing? I know it is just a cartoon, but it has a bit of reality in it as well.
I think most Disney movies score pretty high, well over a 90%.
I think it was a good movie but not a GREAT movie
What do you think would have made it great?
I really not sure, i'm not a cartoon person i guess.
How did you like the ending?
It was a "happy ending", who doesn't love a happy ending?
Judy got what she wanted, wasn't that the point of the movie?
True, she did. And proved she could do the job.

uid2response.feedback: Easy conversation, we both made vaild points and opinions of the movie.
